body_html:
In the blog post they explain: "to maintain numerical precision throughout these operations, we take intermediate QR and LU decompositions during the power iterations." (https://research.fb.com/fast-randomized-svd/)

I skimmed PyTorch docs, it does have potrf for p.s.d matrices, but not a general LU-decomp?

But it's surely possible to do without LU-decomp (probably by simply ignoring lu calls)

But it's surely possible to do without LU-decomp (probably by simply ignoring lu calls)
body:
In the blog post they explain: "to maintain numerical precision throughout these operations, we take intermediate QR and LU decompositions during the power iterations." (https://research.fb.com/fast-randomized-svd/)

I skimmed PyTorch docs, it does have `potrf` for p.s.d matrices, but not a general LU-decomp?

But it's surely possible to do without LU-decomp (probably by simply ignoring lu calls)
